main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Melbourne, Australia in January 1954, including observations of bright flying objects, saucer-shaped objects, and metallic mushroom-shaped objects traveling at high speeds.
interesting points: One sighting described a pale whitish-green object that descended and remained stationary before ascending and disappearing, leading to conclusions that it was probably a balloon or possibly an aircraft.

Another sighting involved an object dropping into view from the east, silver in color and about 40-50 feet in diameter, with small green lights flashing intermittently. The object then ascended rapidly and disappeared, leaving behind a trail of yellow sparks.
A witness reported seeing a metallic mushroom-shaped object flying below minimum safety altitude, occasionally emitting light as if made of celluloid, before disappearing very rapidly.
The sightings caused enough concern that individuals expressed a desire for discretion in publicizing the information to avoid panic and criticism.
One sighting involved an object estimated to be at least 1000 feet up, remaining visible for at least 10 minutes before ascending at a terrific speed, and was described as being not like a meteor.
sighted object: various unidentified flying objects including bright flying objects, saucer-shaped objects, and metallic mushroom-shaped objects
witnesses: multiple witnesses including a civilian, an electrician, and individuals associated with a respectable company
photographs: no photographs included in the report
